scenes.text: Lets get started, talk to Sam, Yasmin, or Riz to find out what stories we have for you.

Sustainability Program

Investigate why the school sustainability rating has dropped and what can be done to improve it.

New Sport!

The school is looking for a new sport to add to the curriculum. Research each one and write about them.

The Campaign

One of the schools presidential candidates has been hacked. Can you solve the mystery of who did it and why?
Great, you are back. Are you ready to write the story?
Place your reporters notebook on the lectern by the window.

scenes.text: Thanks again for your help.
Make sure before you share items online that you check the sources.
Cherry picking is when you only select the most suitable information for your story and disregard anything opposing your point.
Did you know that a straw man fallacy is when you argue with somebody but do not acknowledge what they are actually discussing and instead refute a different argument.
Ad hominem is a type of arguing where the person attacks somebody personally, rather than their argument.
Once you have completed the task for Mr. Day press the button to be taken back to the Guide.

We need you to explore the four new options for a sport to add to the school. You will be asked which sport to choose at the end based on the evidence gathered. Be aware of the reasons people want particular sports!

scenes.text: Diving is absolutely the best idea. You may think it is a problem as we do not have a pool yet, but if we get enough backing, we will be able to get funding to build a pool, and then I can use it all the time.. I mean, the students can use it all the time!
Come back to me after you have done diving!

scenes.text: Penalty Shootouts would be a great addition as it is an active game that gets students moving. I also used to play soccer, almost went professional!
I believe that archery should be the new sport. As the history teacher I believe this will encourage students to learn about history, and I can get some use out of my bow and arrow.

scenes.text: Clearly this is not a sport. You have been sleeping on the job! We cannot publish this article.

Remember to do research on information you learn, especially if you are unsure. Conspiracy theories can manipulate us to offer narratives that help us through tough times, which can lead to people being scapegoated and misinformation spreading.
It is always good to remember that sometimes people will not believe factual evidence even if it is in front of them, nobody is immune to this.
Be wary of fake experts, anybody can claim to be something, so make sure you always double check.
Click the buttom to go back to the fair.

It is the school elections, and one of the candidates has had their social media account hacked! The hacker has spread false information across their account. Explore the rooms, interview people, and complete tasks to get to the truth. Remember to keep checking your notebook!
Listen, I understand you think it would be me as I am running against them, but I would never share lies online, that stuff is there forever.
You have already spoken to me
Speak to the other candidate first!
I would never be involved in such a thing; these are my students and I want what is best for them.
You have already spoken to me.
Speak to the principal first!
Super sad what happened, whoever hacked their socials is obviously trying to make them look bad, there is no way they would ever write such horrible stuff.
You have already spoken to me.
Speak to the others before me!
I am not informing on anybody or giving you any information.
You have already spoken to me.
Please talk to the others.
I totally believed that the candidate would write those things.
You have already spoken to me.
Gather more information before talking to me!
I am outraged that this happened. Gross stuff is now all over my socials, it is so embarassing. It is obvious the other candidate did it.
You have already spoken to me.

Think about why somebody is writing something. Do they have a reason to lie? Are you being persuaded by their writing rather than the facts?
Are you being secretly advertised something? If somebody is supporting a product, is it because they actually like it or are they being paid to do so?
Why is this information being shared? Is there something to gain, or is it genuinely to inform people about the truth?
When you are done interviewing people and conducting research, head back to Paris to hand in your story.
Who do you think is responsible for the hacking? The other candidate, the principal, the friend, the random student, or the candidate themselves?

scenes.text: I originally used ChatGPT to write my article, but it isn't 100% reliable as it is still based on data found online. Instead I now use ChatGPT to check that my article is targeting the right demographics, it can be useful for loads of things like this.
